Package com.visionspace.taskmanager

Interface RunnableTask

public interface RunnableTask
Interface tasks must implement in order to be executed by the task manager.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void run​(java.lang.Object[] args)
    Executes the task, invoked from the worker thread where the task runs.
    default void validate​(java.lang.Object[] args)
    Invoked when the task is created, allows validating task arguments immediately after the task is submitted and fail fast in case of errors, rather than having to wait for the task to be launched to detect invalid arguments.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      default void validate​(java.lang.Object[] args) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Invoked when the task is created, allows validating task arguments immediately after the task is submitted and fail fast in case of errors, rather than having to wait for the task to be launched to detect invalid arguments.

      Keep in mind that there may be a significant time interval between calling this method and calling run(Object[]); therefore, the validations meant to be performed here are essentially time invariant ones; for example, if a task has a file name argument, the validation to perform here is that the file name is valid, not necessarily that the file exists; file existence should be checked on run(Object[]), as the fact that the file exists on validation time doesn't guarantee that it still exists when the task is executed.

      Note that the task runner instance used to validate the arguments is not necessarily the same as the one used for running the task, in fact the task may not even run in the same JVM where it's arguments were validated. Therefore, the validation method should not change any state in the task.

      Parameters:
      args - The task arguments.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are not valid.

    • run

      void run​(java.lang.Object[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Executes the task, invoked from the worker thread where the task runs.
      Parameters:
      args - The task arguments.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - in case there is an execution error.
